title: Takeaways from every NFL Week 2 game: Eagles defeat Chiefs in Super Bowl rematch; Cowboys win in OT
content: NFL Nation reporters react to all the action, answering the biggest questions coming out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 2.

title: Debating Week 2 overreactions: We make sense of the Lions, Cowboys, Eagles, Chiefs
content: Do the Cowboys have playoff hopes? What's up with the Super Bowl duo? We sized up Week 2 overreactions.

title: Sources: Burrow could need surgery for turf toe
content: Cincinnati Bengals star quarterback Joe Burrow is dealing with a turf toe injury that could require surgery, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Sunday night.

title: Eagles quiet Chiefs' talk with scoreboard statement
content: The Eagles got the final word during a hotly contested Super Bowl rematch with the Chiefs on Sunday that was intense to the very end.

title: McCarthy's second start a slog as Falcons soar
content: A week after authoring fourth-quarter heroics in a rousing Minnesota victory, Vikings quarterback J.J. McCarthy and the rest of the offense slogged through 60 mostly rough minutes in a 22-6 loss to the Atlanta Falcons on Sunday night at U.S. Bank Stadium.

title: Cowboys sign Clowney to boost depth, says Jones
content: The Cowboys have signed three-time Pro Bowl edge rusher Jadeveon Clowney to a contract, owner Jerry Jones said after the team's overtime win against the Giants on Sunday.

title: Aces open playoff run with 17th straight victory
content: On Sunday night at Michelob Ultra Arena, the Las Vegas Aces won their 17th consecutive game, opening their WNBA postseason run with a 102-77 decision over the Seattle Storm to move just one victory from tying the league record.

title: Reign-Racing game halted after DeMelo collapses
content: The Seattle Reign and Racing Louisville abandoned their match in the National Women's Soccer League on Sunday night after a medical emergency involving Racing midfielder Savannah DeMelo.

title: Raleigh makes more HR history; M's atop AL West
content: Mariners slugger Cal Raleigh hit his 54th home run, tying Mickey Mantle's record for a switch-hitter and passing Javy Lopez's mark for catchers in a season (43).

title: Scheffler secures sixth win in Ryder Cup tuneup
content: Scottie Scheffler closed with a 5-under 67 to win the Procore Championship for his sixth PGA Tour victory of the year.

title: üèÜ Eagles' petty posts top Week 2 trolls
content: The San Francisco 49ers also made sure to poke fun at the New Orleans Saints after winning on the road, topping Week 2's NFL trolls.

title: Joe Burrow out with turf toe: What is it, and what would extended time away mean for the QB, Bengals?
content: Jake Browning helped deliver a win to the Bengals on Sunday, but what's reasonable to expect from the backup?

title: From dormant to dominant: Why Dominique Malonga could save the Storm
content: The Storm knew all along Dominique Malonga would emerge as a key part of their WNBA title hopes -- whether it's this year or in years to come.

title: 'What's your deal?': Timeline of Jim Harbaugh and Pete Carroll's nearly two-decade-long rivalry
content: The Chargers-Raiders "Monday Night Football" matchup marks a renewal of Jim Harbaugh and Pete Carroll's nearly 20-year beef.

title: Your guide to Sunday's first-round WNBA playoff games
content: The Lynx, Aces, Dream and Liberty each lead their series 1-0. Here's how they did it, and how New York won in the desert.

title: WNBA playoff surprises: Why Dream, Mercury, more could crash the championship party
content: There's a clear three-team title race. Here's how the other five teams could make deeper runs than expected.

title: Late rally seals Kroger Queen City title for Charley Hull
content: Charley Hull, coming off a runner-up finish in Houston last week as part of the Aramco series on the European tour, took advantage of top-ranked Jeeno Thitikul's final-hole putting meltdown on Sunday to win the Kroger Queen City Championship in Ohio.

title: Why Brentford's goal vs. Chelsea wasn't ruled out for offside; Maddison's VAR rage
content: Should Brentford's stoppage-time equaliser against Chelsea have been disallowed for offside against Dango Ouattara?

title: Manchester derby reaction: How City beat United, Donnarumma and Haaland dazzle, more
content: Man City outclassed Man United in Sunday's derby. Here's what you need to know from the fun at the Etihad.

title: Champions League storylines: Will Arsenal win it all, PSG repeat, Barca rebound?
content: The UEFA Champions League kicks into high gear on Tuesday. But who are the favorites? How about the fashionable outsiders? Mark Ogden weighs in on the big clubs and talking points.

title: Ranking Week 2 fantasy football winners and losers and injury impacts from Sunday
content: A summary of Week 2's best and worst fantasy performances, biggest storylines and historical perspective.

title: Fantasy Buzz: Bengals withstand Burrow injury, Lions offense roars
content: Jake Browning stepping in for an injured Joe Burrow and Mac Jones for Brock Purdy highlighted the early window.

title: Jaedyn Shaw has supercharged Gotham FC
content: NJ/NY Gotham FC are rocketing up ESPN's NWSL Power Rankings thanks to the immediate impact of star recruit Jaedyn Shaw.

title: Betting buzz: Derrick Henry stiff-arms betting public
content: It was a popular bet for Derrick Henry to score a touchdown on Sunday, but Baltimore's star RB failed to do so.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid eye Salah free transfer
content: Real Madrid are considering a move for Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah in 2027. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 'Amounts to theft': Russia furious over frozen assets; warns EU states
content: Russia has issued a warning. It says it will target any European nation that tries to seize its assets. This follows reports that the European Union is exploring ways to use frozen Russian funds to support Ukraine. Russia considers any seizure of its assets as theft.

title: Handshake row takes ugly turn: Pak threaten to withdraw from Asia Cup
content: Tensions escalate at the Asia Cup as Pakistan threaten withdrawal if match referee Andy Pycroft isn't removed. The PCB formally complained to the ICC, alleging Code of Conduct violations after a handshake controversy during the India-Pakistan match. Pakistan alleges Pycroft instructed their captain to avoid shaking hands, and expressed disappointment at India's post-match behavior.

title: Trade deal soon? US chief negotiator to land in India tonight; talks begin tomorrow
content: Amidst signs of easing trade tensions, the US chief negotiator is set to arrive in India tonight, paving the way for renewed trade discussions starting tomorrow. This visit follows recent social media exchanges between Prime Minister Modi and President Trump, indicating a potential thaw in relations previously strained by US tariffs on Indian imports, particularly concerning Russian oil purchases.

title: Is Nano Banana AI tool safe: Safety concerns raised; what experts say
content: The Google Gemini Nano Banana AI trend, transforming photos into stylized portraits, has surged on Instagram, sparking privacy concerns. Experts warn about potential risks associated with uploading personal images, as watermarks identifying AI-generated content can be tampered with. Authorities advise caution against fake websites and urge users to protect their data and finances.

title: 'Jalebi Baby' Pakistan anthem blunder; artist Tesher says 'shout out to the sound guy'
content: The Asia Cup 2025 match between India and Pakistan faced an unusual start with 'Jalebi Baby' mistakenly played instead of Pakistan's anthem, prompting a complaint from the PCB. India secured a dominant seven-wicket victory, chasing down Pakistan's 128-run target, led by Suryakumar Yadav's unbeaten 47. Kuldeep Yadav's stellar bowling earned him Player of the Match for the second consecutive game.

title: New drama in handshake row: PCB lodges complaint; demands removal
content: The Pakistan Cricket Board has formally complained to the ICC regarding missing handshakes during the Asia Cup clash with India, demanding the removal of the Match Referee. The PCB alleges violations of the ICC Code of Conduct and MCC Laws, claiming the referee instructed their captain to avoid shaking hands.

title: What India‚Äôs data engineering boom really looks like in 2025
content: India‚Äôs data engineering boom in 2025 is driving the backbone of the digital economy. With market size projected to exceed USD 42 billion, demand for skilled engineers outpaces supply, pushing salaries higher. Banking, e-commerce, and healthcare lead recruitment, while Python, cloud, and database expertise dominate the skills landscape. Attrition challenges persist, but opportunities remain transformative.

title: ‚ÄòNot charging enough': Salesforce CEO‚Äôs jokes about Palantir software cost
content: Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff has taken a swipe at Palantir's high prices, joking about their expensive software and impressive revenue multiple. This comes amid surging investor enthusiasm for Palantir, despite Salesforce's larger revenue. The rivalry between the two companies intensifies as they compete for government contracts, with Benioff highlighting Salesforce's recent win in a US Army deal.

title: BMW rams bike: Driver arrested; victim was taken to kin's hospital 22km away
content: Gaganpreet Kaur was arrested for allegedly driving the BMW that caused the death of finance ministry officer Navjot Singh in Dhaula Kuan. Singh's wife, Sandeep, injured in the crash, accused Kaur of delaying proper medical care, opting for a distant hospital linked to her relatives.

title: Nepal's interim govt: PM Karki unveils cabinet; Ghising made minister
content: Following violent demonstrations sparked by a social media ban and fueled by economic frustrations, Nepal's interim prime minister, Sushila Karki, has appointed her initial cabinet. The appointments aim to stabilize the nation and address demands for clean governance as Karki prepares to lead the country towards elections in March.

title: Left out of Asia Cup squad! Siraj grabs spotlight with new achievement; speaks out
content: India's Mohammed Siraj has been named ICC Player of the Month for August 2023 after his match-winning performance against England, helping India level the series. Ireland's Orla Prendergast also received the award for her outstanding performance in a T20I series against Pakistan and the ICC Women's T20 World Cup Europe Qualifier.

title: Apple iOS 26 release today: India release time; supported iPhone models and more
content: Apple is launching iOS 26 today, September 15th, at 10:30 PM IST, bringing a significant design overhaul and new features. The update introduces 'Liquid Glass,' Call Screening, Live Translation, and AutoMix. Compatible with iPhone 11 series and newer, iOS 26 enhances Messages, Apple Music, and CarPlay. Apple Intelligence features are exclusive to iPhone 15 Pro and later models.

title: ‚ÄòBullying‚Äô: China slams Trump call for tariffs on Russia oil importers
content: China has strongly condemned the US proposal for G7 and NATO nations to impose tariffs on Chinese imports of Russian oil, labeling it as "unilateral bullying" and "economic coercion." Beijing warned of retaliatory measures if countries comply with Washington's request.

title: 'I only regret she didn‚Äôt die in front of me': Gwalior murderer‚Äôs chilling confession
content: Arvind Parihar fatally shot his wife, Nandini Kewat, outside a stadium in Gwalior, showing no remorse and expressing relief from their constant arguments. The murder followed a complaint Nandini filed against him and his anger over a birthday video she posted with another man. Parihar, already married with children, accused Nandini of infidelity and financial exploitation before the deadly act.

title: Uttarakhand fire dept blunder: 900m sprint in 60 seconds with 65kg load required
content: Uttarakhand's recruitment rules for fire officers initially demanded an impossible feat: a 900m sprint with 65kg in 60 seconds. This unrealistic benchmark, faster than Olympic records, sparked online ridicule. The state government quickly acknowledged the error as a 'typo' and promised a revised, more reasonable assessment of fitness for applicants.

title: Lamar Jackson sparks fury: From league‚Äôs global push to war zone concerns
content: Baltimore Ravens' quarterback Lamar Jackson has voiced concerns regarding the NFL's international expansion, particularly into conflict zones. While acknowledging the benefits of global promotion, Jackson emphasized player safety as his top priority. His reluctance comes as the NFL plans six more international games this season, highlighting the tension between business growth and player welfare.

title: Asia Cup: 'Bachey hi reh gaye' - Pak face backlash after humiliating loss to India
content: India dominated Pakistan in their Asia Cup encounter, securing a convincing seven-wicket victory. Kuldeep Yadav's stellar bowling performance earned him Player of the Match, while Suryakumar Yadav anchored the chase with an unbeaten 47. India's bowlers delivered a clinical performance, restricting Pakistan to a low score, which India chased down comfortably, propelling them to the top of Group A.

title: ‚ÄòWhere is the MLA?‚Äô: Bengaluru residents mark potholes in protest
content: Jayanagar residents are protesting unfinished "model road" projects promised two years ago by MLA CK Ramamurthy. Dug-up streets and broken footpaths have sparked resident action, including protests and pothole markings. While the South City Corporation assures allocated funds will be used for repairs, residents express frustration over delays and unresponsive officials.

title: 'Not going to play': Patrick Mahomes injury blow revealed; what Andy Reid said
content: The Kansas City Chiefs will face the Philadelphia Eagles in Week 2 without rookie wide receiver Xavier Worthy due to a knee injury. Coach Andy Reid confirmed Worthy's absence, impacting the Chiefs' offensive strategy. Worthy's speed and deep-threat ability will be missed, placing more pressure on Travis Kelce and other receivers to perform against the Eagles' strong defense.

title: 'Never in royal history': Meghan Markle‚Äôs shock after marrying Prince Harry
content: Meghan Markle's royal expectations clashed dramatically with reality, according to a royal biographer. She envisioned a fairytale life but was given a modest cottage and strict protocols. Meghan felt stifled, unable to express herself or make her own choices.

title: MP girl found dead on tracks; was under pressure to marry
content: Payal, a 24-year-old woman working near Mandideep, was found dead on railway tracks in Misrod, with police suspecting suicide. Family pressure regarding marriage proposals, against Payal's wishes, is being investigated as a potential factor.

title: Handshake row escalates: Pakistan cry foul, lodge protest against India in Dubai
content: The India‚ÄìPakistan T20I ended in controversy after Suryakumar Yadav refused handshakes, citing solidarity with victims of the Pahalgam terror attack. Pakistan lodged a protest, alleging a breach of sportsmanship, while Salman Ali Agha skipped the presentation.

title: Husband turns matchmaker: UP man marries off wife to her lover at temple
content: In Amethi, Shiv Shankar facilitated his wife Uma's marriage to her lover, Vishal, after discovering their ongoing affair despite their marriage in March. Unable to persuade Uma to end the relationship, Shiv Shankar arranged the wedding at Aditya Birla Temple, completing all rituals and personally bidding her farewell. The unusual event has sparked widespread discussion in the region.

title: Asia Cup: India to be penalised for no handshakes? Here‚Äôs what the rules say
content: India's Asia Cup victory over Pakistan is now embroiled in controversy as the Indian team, led by Suryakumar Yadav, skipped the customary post-match handshake, citing directives from the government and BCCI. This action, potentially violating the ICC's Spirit of Cricket, drew criticism from Pakistan's coach, leading to a formal protest.

title: ITR filing deadline today: How to file tax returns; step-by-step guide for taxpayers
content: ITR filing FY 2024-25: The Income Tax Department extended the ITR filing deadline or due date for AY 2025-26 to September 15, 2025. Filing after this date incurs penalties. The article provides a step-by-step guide for filing ITR-1 (Sahaj) through the income tax e-filing website.

title: Woman poisoned, beaten to death over dowry in Uttar Pradesh; 5 booked
content: In Bithaura Kalan village, Kusma Devi, a 28-year-old woman, was allegedly poisoned and fatally bludgeoned due to dowry demands. Her husband, Chandra Pal, along with his parents, brother, and sister, are accused of demanding Rs 1 lakh, a motorbike, and a gold chain.

title: Minor sisters dragged to jungle, gang-raped in Singrauli
content: In Singrauli district, two minor sisters, ages 16 and 17, were abducted and gang-raped in a jungle. The victims were discovered unconscious by police and locals after the horrific incident, which occurred while they were traveling to their aunt's village. Police have arrested three local residents in connection with the crime, and an investigation is ongoing.

title: Who are Bob Vylan? British punk-rap duo mocks Charlie Kirk‚Äôs assassination
content: British punk-rap duo Bob Vylan ignited controversy after Bobby Vylan seemingly mocked Charlie Kirk's assassination during an Amsterdam performance, making gun gestures and sniper jokes. This followed earlier backlash for chanting "Death to the IDF" at Glastonbury, causing visa issues. The incidents have sparked debates about free speech, artistic expression, and the potential for inciting political violence through performance.

title: Small-town pivot: Tier-2 & 3 fuel India‚Äôs study abroad boom; state board students shine
content: India‚Äôs global education story is changing. For the first time, students from Tier 2 and 3 cities now make up over 57% of those studying abroad, up from 47% last year, according to UpGrad‚Äôs Transnational Education Report 2024‚Äì25. First-generation learners from State Boards are leading the charge, harnessing digital tools and sheer determination, rewriting a narrative once dominated by metro elites, while raising urgent questions about opportunities at home.

title: Govt official killed as BMW hits bike; victim taken 22km away to hospital
content: Navjot Singh, a deputy secretary, died in a road accident, prompting questions about the delay in medical assistance. His son, Navnoor, revealed the couple's accident near Dhaula Kuan after visiting Gurdwara Bangla Sahib. Concerns arose as they were taken to a distant hospital, Nulife Hospital, while closer options like AIIMS and Safdarjung were available.

title: Former NBA Champion Andrew Bogut reveals: How Charlie Kirk's death impacted Australians
content: Andrew Bogut, the former NBA champion, has amplified the Australian reaction to Charlie Kirk's assassination. Bogut shared posts from Australian commentators highlighting concerns about public safety and freedom of speech following the incident at Utah Valley University. The posts also dissect the broader implications of Kirk's killing on public trust and political discourse.

title: Did BJP minister Jibesh Mishra assault journalist? Tejashwi presents video proof
content: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav has strongly criticized PM Modi and CM Nitish Kumar, demanding action against Bihar minister Jibesh Mishra for allegedly assaulting a journalist who questioned road conditions. Yadav presented a video purportedly showing the incident and highlighted Mishra's alleged involvement in a fake drug case.

title: Oman property ownership for foreigners: Laws, rights, and requirements to know
content: Oman allows foreign nationals to own property under specific laws, primarily within Integrated Tourism Complexes (ITCs) and through regulated usufruct rights. This guide details the legal framework, eligibility, required documents, zones open to foreign buyers, and restrictions. It also outlines key risks, mortgage options, and recent policy updates aimed at attracting long-term investment while protecting national interests.

title: Heavy rain, poor visibility hit Pune flights: Airlines issue advisories
content: Heavy rains and poor visibility caused significant disruptions at Pune airport, leading to the diversion of 14 flights and delays for several others between midnight and 8 am. Passengers faced considerable inconvenience as flights were rerouted to Ahmedabad and Mumbai, with some travelers stranded for hours.

title: Activist who accused Haryana SP of sex abuse shoots self dead
content: Haryana Police reported that social activist Sunil Kapoor, accused of involvement in sexual harassment allegations against former SP Sumit Kumar, allegedly shot himself dead during a police cordon in Dehradun. A joint police team raided Kapoor's hideout after a case was registered against him related to a viral letter containing the allegations.

title: Asia Cup: Were India cricketers forced to play Pakistan? Ex-player‚Äôs bold claim
content: Suresh Raina ignited controversy by claiming Indian cricketers were ‚Äúforced‚Äù by the BCCI to participate in the Asia Cup 2025, despite their reluctance. This revelation follows India's victory over Pakistan, marred by a 'handshake-gate' incident where the Indian team declined post-match handshakes, citing solidarity with victims of the Pahalgam terror attack.

title: Gold beats Sensex with 50.1% returns; outperforms in a big way; what should investors do?
content: Gold has outperformed domestic equities, delivering substantial returns due to central banks' buying and investors seeking inflation protection. Over the past year, gold yielded 50.1% in rupee terms, while the Sensex declined. Experts suggest maintaining a 10-15% gold allocation for portfolio diversification.

title: Emmy Awards: Tribute to Amy Cole, Owen Cooper‚Äôs win as youngest actor; & more
content: The 77th Annual Emmy Awards 2025 witnessed historic wins and emotional tributes. Tramell Tillman became the first Black man to win Best Supporting Actor in a Drama Series for 'Severance.' Stephen Colbert honored his late colleague, Amy Cole, in a tearful speech. Hannah Einbinder's acceptance speech was partially censored due to a political statement.

title: Katrina Kaif, Vicky Kaushal expecting first baby, due in Oct-Nov: Report
content: Vicky Kaushal and Katrina Kaif are expecting their first child. A source close to the couple confirmed the news. The baby is due in October or November. Katrina plans to take a long maternity break. Vicky is currently filming 'Love & War' with Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt. His film 'Chhaava' was a box office success this year.

title: Asia Cup: 'Stop trying to be Shahid Afridi' - Afridi slams Pakistan after India rout
content: Following Pakistan's crushing defeat to India in the Asia Cup, former captain Shahid Afridi criticised the team's batting and bowling. He specifically called out Saim Ayub's reckless approach and questioned resting key fast bowlers. Wasim Akram noted the batsmen's struggle against Kuldeep Yadav's spin, while Sunil Gavaskar labeled Pakistan a weak team.

title: 5-year Islam practice clause put on hold: SC imposes partial stay on Waqf Act; 3 key provisions stayed
content: The Supreme Court has partially stayed the Waqf Amendment Act 2025, specifically the provision requiring five years of Islamic practice to create a Waqf, pending rule formulation. While refusing a complete stay, the court emphasized the importance of having a Muslim CEO for Waqf Boards and restricted the creation of third-party rights on disputed properties.

title: How Ukraine attacks on Russia refineries are benefiting India
content: Ukraine's drone attacks on Russian oil refineries created a crisis, which India has seized as an opportunity. Indian refiners are capitalizing on discounted Urals crude, boosting refining margins and exports, particularly diesel to Europe. Despite potential risks from fluctuating discounts and geopolitical pressures, India maintains its strategic autonomy in energy decisions.

title: 'Time for being soft is over': Trump reacts to Indian man beheading by 'illegal alien'
content: Donald Trump condemned the beheading of Chandra Nagamallaiah, allegedly by a Cuban "illegal alien" with a prior criminal record, in Dallas, Texas. Trump criticised the Biden administration's immigration policies, claiming the suspect should not have been in the country. He vowed to prosecute the killer to the fullest extent of the law and promised a tougher stance on illegal immigrant criminals if he were in power.

title: Web designer gets off car in Bengaluru to help injured dog, gets molested twice
content: In Bengaluru, a 29-year-old web designer was molested twice while aiding an injured stray dog. The accused, Manjunath, fled but was later traced by police. Witnesses chased him after the second assault, leading to his fall and injuries. Police are investigating the incident, and Manjunath's parents have assured his cooperation. The case was registered under relevant sections of the law.

title: Delhi To Have 10 "Namo Van" To Boost Green Cover, Combat Pollution: Rekha Gupta
content: Delhi government will develop 10 "Namo Van" across the city to enhance green cover and combat air pollution, Chief Minister Rekha Gupta said on Monday.

title: PM Opens New Airport In Bihar. Why This May Help NDA's Seemanchal Poll Plan
content: As the Bihar political arena gears up for a high-voltage Assembly election, Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to inaugurate an airport at Purnea in the politically significant Seemanchal region

title: First Russian Oil, Now American Corn: How US Is Using Tariffs Against India
content: Even before trade negotiations between India and the United States resumed, US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick warned that New Delhi could lose its access to the American market if it refuses to purchase US-grown corn.

title: 3 Drown While Taking Bath In River Following Cremation Rituals In Rajasthan: Cops
content: The last rites of four accident victims took a turn for the worse after three men drowned while taking bath in a river following the cremation rituals in Rajasthan's Bhilwara district on Monday.

title: 'Can Scrap Bihar Poll Roll Revision Even After Final List If...': Supreme Court
content: Reiterating its stand on the controversial Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in Bihar, the Supreme Court said the entire process can be scrapped even after the final voter list is published if any illegality is found.

title: How To Transform Your Selfie Into A Bollywood-Style Red Saree Poster
content: The saree edits range from flowing chiffons in vivid or pastel hues to striking red or black sarees, and even gentle whites with polka dots.

title: From Gaza To Europe On Jet Ski: Palestinian Man's Daring Escape Story
content: It took more than a year, several thousand dollars, ingenuity, setbacks and a jet ski: this is how Muhammad Abu Dakha, a 31-year-old Palestinian, managed to escape from Gaza to reach Europe.

title: Students' Body AMSU Launches Assam Economic Blockade Over Scheduled Tribe Status Delay
content: The Morans, Tai Ahoms, Mottocks, Koch Rajbongshis, Sooteas, and Tea Tribes - remain classified as Other Backward Classes (OBCs).

title: New York Governor Endorses Zohran Mamdani In Mayoral Race
content: New York Governor Kathy Hochul has endorsed Democratic nominee Zohran Mamdani for mayor of New York City, a key affirmation for the 33-year-old frontrunner whose candidacy hasn't yet been fully embraced by members of his own party.

title: What We Know About Couple In BMW Which Rammed Finance Ministry Official
content: The couple in the BMW lives in Gurugram, police said, adding that they own a business of making horse leather saddles, seats, covers, and belts.

title: Why Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills Poll Contest Is More Than A By-Election
content: The Jubilee Hills by-poll is a prestige battle that carries significant political implications for the BRS and Congress.

title: "Unfathomable": Trump On 'Hatred' Between Zelensky, Putin Amid US Truce Efforts
content: US President Donald Trump, who once claimed he could stop the war between Russia and Ukraine within hours, claims the hatred between Russia's Vladimir Putin and Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelensky is "unfathomable" amid American peace efforts.

title: Prince Harry Has 'Clear Conscience' Over Explosive Memoir 'Spare'
content: With its unstinting depiction of the royals and at times uncomfortably detailed account of his life as a prince, "Spare" flew off the shelves after its release in January 2023.

title: Supreme Court Refuses To Bring Political Parties Under Sexual Harassment Law
content: The Supreme Court on Monday refused to entertain a plea seeking to bring women engaged in political sector under the protection of anti-sexual harassment law.

title: Passenger Arrested With 67 Exotic Animals At Mumbai Airport
content: A man was arrested by the Customs at the Mumbai international airport allegedly with 67 exotic animals hidden in his luggage, an official said on Monday.

title: The Bitter Relationship Between Israel And Arab States
content: Israel's bombing of Qatar last week risks a new breach with Arab states who are meeting on Monday, opening another chapter in a fractious history since Israel's creation in 1948 marked by repeated wars and periods of frosty peace.

title: 5 Bangladeshi Students To Face Deportation Over Campus Violence In Assam
content: Five Bangladeshi students of the National Institute of Technology in Assam's Silchar have been suspended for violent clashes inside the campus and authorities have decided to hand them over for deportation.

title: 2 Utah Men Arrested For "Threat Of Terrorism" Days After Charlie Kirk Shooting
content: The Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI) has detained two men after an explosive device was found under a news media vehicle in Utah's Salt Lake City.

title: Suchir Balaji's Mother New Charge As Sam Altman Calls OpenAI Whistleblower's Death "Suicide"
content: OpenAI whistleblower Suchir Balaji's parents have once again questioned the official suicide ruling, adding that he may have been murdered.

title: China‚Äôs twin avatars, as neighbour and potential superpower, changing the complexion of Indo-China ties: Tirumurti
content: ‚ÄúThe old template is not enough, and we need to develop a new one to deal with China in both these avatars,‚Äù said the former Permanent Representative of India to the United Nations

title: Three farmers injured in clash at fertiliser distribution centre in Madhya Pradesh‚Äôs Morena
content: The incident occurred at the distribution centre in the city grain market premises, where farmers had queued up since the early hours of the day, an official said

title: BJP highlights India‚Äôs economic transformation under PM Modi; welcomes GST reforms
content: ‚ÄúUnder PM Modi‚Äôs leadership over the last eleven years, India has emerged as a respected and rapidly growing global economy,‚Äù BJP national spokesperson said

title: Social impact organisation plans safety audit of Kochi and Thiruvananthapuram cities
content: Safetipin CEO says major issues noticed in the two cities concern to safe public transport and transport hubs, public toilets for women, accessibility of public parks to girls and women

title: District Collectors‚Äô role is extremely crucial in achieving 15% growth rate: CM
content: The District Collectors have to keep their role in accomplishing those multiple tasks in mind and take decisions not merely from the administrative perspective but with a humane touch, Chief Minister said at Collectors‚Äô Conference

title: Vembanad fish count to be held on September 25-26
content: Event will bring together researchers, students, fishers, and conservation enthusiasts to document the fish diversity of Vembanad Lake

title: AIADMK general secretary to decide on unity issue: Jayakumar
content: The party‚Äôs former interim general secretary V.K. Sasikala, in a separate statement, reiterated the need for unity among all members of the organisation

title: Muslim panchayat member in Kerala carries out last rites of Hindu woman from Chhattisgarh
content: Cancer-stricken 44-year-old inmate of a psycho social rehabilitation centre in his ward had expressed a wish that her last rites be conducted as per the Hindu custom

title: Job aspirants protest in Patna; police use batons to disperse crowd
content: The demonstrators were demanding the announcement of the total vacancies and the exam date for the recruitment of constables in the Bihar Police

title: Government SC Hostel students attack woman cook in inebriated condition, case booked
content: In her complaint, the cook alleged that she found a few students consuming liquor on the hostel premises and threatened to lodge a complaint against them, later a group of students entered the kitchen threw a blanket on her and thrashed her

title: Andhra Pradesh outpaces national average with 10.5% GSDP growth in Q1 2025-26
content: Valued at ‚Çπ81,496 crore, the Agriculture and allied sectors¬†grew at 9.6% against the national average of 3.2%

title: Supreme Court order on Waqf Act good sign for democracy, says Rijiju
content: The Supreme Court has put on hold several key provisions of the Act, including the clause that only those practising Islam for the last five years can dedicate a property as Waqf

title: Champions Boat League: Kerala‚Äôs snakeboats to set sail in another season of fierce rivalries
content: This season, the league will feature 14 races, beginning on Pampa river at Kainakary in Kuttanad, Alappuzha, on September 19. The nearly three-month-long pan-Kerala event is set to conclude with President‚Äôs Trophy on Ashtamudi Lake in Kollam on December 6

title: BMTC bus gutted near HAL in Bengaluru, all passengers and crew safe
content: Immediately after the fire was noticed, the bus crew informed the Fire and Emergency Services Department. Fire personnel reached the spot and extinguished the fire. However, the bus was gutted

title: Mauritian PM winds up four-day visit to Uttarakhand
content: The Chief Minister also offered the Mauritius Prime Minister the 'prasad' of Chardham and gifted him products of  Uttarakhand's umbrella brand 'House of Himalayas' as a souvenir

title: DSC to be conducted annually: Lokesh¬†¬†
content: The Minister called upon the teaching community to mentor and guide the new educators as they embark on the noble journey

title: CBI conducts raids in Valmiki Corporation case in Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh

content: The DMK, alongside others, challenged the Bill and Tamil Nadu government passed an Assembly resolution urging the Union government to withdraw it, Mr. Stalin recalled

title: Supreme Court refuses to hear plea alleging minor's custodial torture, asks petitioner to move HC
content: Plea claimed the minor was picked up on August 18 by the police of Botad town in Gujarat suspecting his role in the theft of gold and cash and was brutally beaten up by police officers at the police station and subjected to sexual assault

content: In the first phase, a total of 6,082 children will receive a monthly aid of ‚Çπ2,000 each until they complete their school education

title: Woman driver of BMW that killed finance ministry official taken into police custody

title: Welcome Supreme Court order on Waqf as win for constitutional values of justice, equality, fraternity: Congress
content: Jairam Ramesh said Supreme Court‚Äôs order represents a substantial victory not just for the parties that opposed this arbitrary law in Parliament but all those members of the Joint Parliamentary Committee

title: Kerala Assembly pays tribute to V.S. Achuthanandan, P.P. Thankachan and Vazhoor Soman as 14th session opens
content: Achuthanandan, who died on July 21 aged 101, is remembered as an inspiring and popular figure who, transcending mere party politics, effectively intervened in a wide range of issues affecting the public

title: Supreme Court-appointed SIT gives clean chit to Vantara
content: The SIT had been tasked with conducting an ‚Äúindependent factual appraisal‚Äù of complaints and allegations of violations raised against the facility.

title: SFI steps up protest against Kerala legislator Rahul Mamkootathil, blocks his car outside MLA quarters

title: Watch: When record rains turned Kamareddy into a disaster zone
content: The Ganesh Chaturthi festival brought not cheer but chaos as record rains turned Kamareddy into a disaster zone.

title: Supreme Court to pass order on September 26 in suo motu case over lack of functional CCTVs in police stations
content: In December 2020, the top court had directed the Centre to install CCTV cameras and recording equipment at the offices of investigating agencies, including the CBI, the ED and the National Investigation Agency (NIA)

title: Suresh Gopi faces backlash over ‚Äòdismissive‚Äô response to senior citizen‚Äôs plea
content: Video footage of Union Minister Suresh Gopi returning the written request seeking restoration of collapsed house roof to the petitioner, allegedly without a glance, goes viral

content: Rahul Gandhi, after arriving in Amritsar, headed to Ghonewal village in Amritsar‚Äôs Ajnala and met the flood-hit people to enquire about the damage

title: Speeding vehicle crashes into divider on ORR near Abdullapurmet; 25-year-old woman techie killed, seven injured
content: The group of eight were returning from a temple when the accident occurred after entering the ORR at Exit 10

title: Regulations should foster technology innovations, not wipe them out, says Nirmala Sitharaman
content: The challenge not just in jobs, but also in a way in which these can be misused which can have repercussions for the society, the Union Finance Minister said

title: Supreme Court to pass order on September 23 in suo motu matter over environmental conditions in Himachal Pradesh
content: Observing the situation in the State had deteriorated, the Supreme Court had earlier said climate change was having a "visible and alarming impact" on the State

title: Justice M Sundar takes oath as Chief Justice of Manipur High Court
content: Governor Ajay Kumar Bhalla administered the oath of office to Justice Sundar at a function in the Raj Bhavan

title: Supreme Court refuses to stay Waqf (Amendment) Act 2025 in its entirety
content: Supreme Court notes that ‚Äòpresumption always in favour of constitutionality of a statute.‚Äô It stays certain crucial Sections in the amendment law of 2025

title: Kerala Catholic Church mouthpiece hits back at RSS organ Kesari‚Äôs attack on Christians
content: Editorial in Deepika states that Kesari article ‚Äòlays bare the true colours‚Äô of Sangh Parivar and is ‚Äòpart of calculated conspiracy to undermine the Constitution by targeting Christians‚Äô

title: Former TMC MP Mimi Chakraborty appears before ED in betting app PMLA case
content: The statement of Ms. Chakraborty, 36, is being recorded under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) in a case related to an "illegal" betting app named 1xBet

title: Rain lashes Jharkhand; heavy rain alert issued for 16 districts
content: The IMD issued a yellow alert for East Singhbhum, West Singhbhum, Simdega, Seraikela-Kharswan, Deoghar, Dumka, Giridih, Jamtara and a few other districts

title: Sarada teacher, pillar of Kalakshetra legacy, passes away at 96
content: She was born on 15 June, 1929, in the Theosophical Society campus in Adyar; played an instrumental role in shaping and standardising the Kalakshetra methodology for Bharatanatyam

title: Hike to down shutters; Founder Kavin Mittal terms it difficult decision
content: The real money online gaming space was dealt a fatal blow after Parliament passed the Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Bill, 2025

title: Pulse Rewards loyalty programme launched for passengers at KIA Bengaluru

title: Karnataka High Court declines to interfere with government‚Äôs invitation to Banu Mushtaq to inaugurate Mysuru Dasara this year
content: The petitioners questioned the State Government inviting a person who has no faith in worshipping Hindu gods to inaugurate the Dasara festival, which commences by worshipping a goddess as per Hindu rituals

content: Bombay High Court Chief Justice Shree Chandrashekhar administered the oath of office to Mr. Devvrat at the Raj Bhavan in Mumbai

title: Boy injured in landmine blast in J&K's Anantnag District dies
content: The boy was injured when a landmine, planted for the security of the ammunition depot at Khundru, went off

title: Abducted truck driver rescued from ex-IAS probationer Puja Khedkar's house

title: Congress MLA Rahul Mamkootathil appears at Kerala Assembly, ends self-imposed political exile amid sexual misconduct charges

title: First cargo parcel train from Kashmir valley to Delhi flagged off; L-G says service will boost local economy
content: The cargo parcel train was flagged off from Nowgam railway station here and is scheduled to reach Delhi on Tuesday (September 16, 2025)

title: Nuh‚Äôs madrasas weigh Haryana government‚Äôs modern education push

title: Farmer electrocuted in Belagavi district

content: The conference is the apex brainstorming forum of the armed forces, bringing together the nation‚Äôs top civil and military leadership to exchange views at the conceptual and strategic levels

title: Three Maoists carrying bounty of ‚Çπ1.35 crore killed in Hazaribagh

title: Mumbai drenched on first day of week; heavy rains affect morning commute
content: The heavy downpour, which began around midnight with lightning and thunder, continued in the morning, leading to inundation of low-lying areas like King's Circle and other areas

title: SC hearing on Waqf (Amendment) Act LIVE: Top court order welcomed by political parties
content: SC stays provision that mandates a disputed property would not be treated as waqf unless the executive permits it after an enquiry

title: Indian Navy gets anti-submarine warfare ship
content: The name ‚ÄòAndroth‚Äô holds strategic and symbolic significance as it is derived from the Androth Island in the Lakshadweep archipelago, underscoring India‚Äôs commitment to safeguarding its vast maritime territories

title: Music composer Ilaiyaraaja accepts T.N. CM Stalin‚Äôs request to set Sangam literature to music

title: States should get compensation for GST revenue loss; eco growth should benefit all: Kerala FM

title: U.S. immigration authorities detain 73-year-old Sikh woman in California; family calls for her release
content: Harjit Kaur, who has lived in the East Bay in Northern California for more than 30 years, was detained by Immigration and Customs Enforcement officials during a routine check-in earlier this week

title: West Bengal records highest child marriages in India at 6.3%, reveals data
content: Even after a decade of dedicated schemes targeting elimination of child marriage in West Bengal like Kanyashree Prakalpa the state records very high incidents of child marriage both in rural and urban areas

title: White-coats walk out in protest: Chhattisgarh‚Äôs health workers are on strike¬†¬†

title: Milad juloos winds through Hyderabad amid prayers and pageantry

title: WNBA playoff schedule: Every game in the first round, starting Sunday
content: the WNBA playoffs are finally here . the first round is a 1-1-1 format, with the higher seed hosting Game 1 and Game 3 . if necessary, the finals will expand to a best-of-seven series (2-2-1-1-1) format .

title: After defeating Canelo, is Crawford the best fighter of his generation?

title: College football betting: Can the Irish still win the national championship?

title: Why Geno Smith is settling in for the long haul in Las Vegas
